text: Netsuke is a Japanese miniature sculpture. It appeared in the 17th century. Originally It looked like a hanging keychain on Japanese traditional clothing called kimono. Netsuke was a button fastener on the cords of an inro box. Netsuke is made of various materials: ivory, boxwood, metal, boar tusk, clay and so on. Category:Japanese art Category:Sculptures Category:17th-century works Category:17th century in art
title: Netsuke
